snippet: John DeLong, the agency’s director of compliance, said that the overwhelming majority of “incidents” shown in an internal audit were the result of unintentional human or technical errors.
abstract: John DeLong, National Security Agency director of compliance, pushes back against reports that the agency has frequently violated privacy rules, after publication of leaked internal audit showing that there had been 2,776 such 'incidents' in a one-year period; DeLong says number of mistakes was extremely low compared with its overall activities.
lead_paragraph: John DeLong, the agency’s director of compliance, said that the overwhelming majority of “incidents” shown in an internal audit were the result of unintentional human or technical errors.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
